ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 10A is a 22.5 km challenging circular hike in the UK, offering varied terrain and significant elevation gain. Designed as a shortcut iteration of C10, it tests endurance and navigation for experienced hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines mixed terrain: forest tracks, grassy heaths, rough trails, and occasional watercourses. Expect uneven footing, exposed sections, and several climbs with long descents. Navigation relies on waypoints and occasional trail markers.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day; check weather and daylight. Carry map and compass and know how to use them; bring a charged phone as a backup. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate layers; carry waterproofs. Stay hydrated and fueled; watch for sudden changes in hill or woodland conditions. Tell someone your plan and expected return time. In winter, reduce pace and be prepared for ice and reduced visibility; consider additional safety gear.
recommended_gear: High-energy snacks and a light meal
Map and compass (and GPS as backup)
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly April–October) for longer daylight and milder conditions; autumn can be rewarding but weather is more changeable; plan for winter hikes with extra precautions if attempted.

seo.title: ACW Circular Walk 10A (C10 Shortcut) – 22.5 km Hard Circular Hike in the UK
